experiences.role: Scholarship to be Cloud Engineer in Japan Awardee
experiences.company: Kebun Academy x PT ANC Japan
experiences.description: Selected for a year-long scholarship program preparing candidates for Cloud Engineering careers in Japan through intensive JLPT N3-level Japanese language training, AWS Cloud professional certification, and career preparation including interview opportunities with Japanese companies.

Completed the AWS re/Start program, gaining hands-on experience in IT fundamentals, Linux, networking, security, Python, databases, and core AWS cloud services. Trained through scenario-based labs and projects, including cloud architecture, automation, serverless, containers, and monitoring, while also developing essential workplace and professional skills.
technologies: AWS (EC2, S3, VPC, Cloudwatch, IAM, Lambda)

experiences.description: Completed an intensive, fully funded training program focused on full-stack web development, cloud services, UI/UX fundamentals, data analysis, and AI ethics—combining hands-on projects with real industry workflows.

Developed and maintained responsive web applications, fixed software issues, and collaborated with cross-functional teams to deliver reliable digital solutions, including a government platform for distributing free rice cookers to priority groups.
Provided weekly mentoring and live sessions for Python beginners, evaluated student projects, and supported a 180+ member community through active Discord moderation.

Supported departmental projects by developing IoT prototypes, creating digital microscope motion systems, and designing interactive LED installations for campus events. Helped produce workshop materials and trial-class modules while undergoing training in 3D printing, PCB design, and equipment operation.

Provided technical support for system configuration, installation, and troubleshooting across hardware, software, and server environments. Implemented automated Apache log rotation for efficient log management and performed daily monitoring of 16+ client servers via remote tools.
This period marked my foundation in software and hardware development, where I gained core skills through academic projects, lab work, and hands-on engineering practices.
